== Acknowledgments

We are grateful to Stuart Caie and the libmspack project for:

* Creating an excellent, comprehensive implementation of Microsoft compression formats
* Providing thorough test coverage with diverse test cases
* Maintaining high-quality, well-documented code
* Making these test fixtures available for validation purposes

The libmspack project can be found at: https://www.cabextract.org.uk/libmspack/

== Usage

These test fixtures are used solely for testing and validation of the Cabriolet
implementation. They are not distributed as part of the Cabriolet runtime gem.

The fixtures test various scenarios:

* Normal CAB files with different compression methods
* Multi-part cabinet sets
* Edge cases and malformed files
* Security vulnerability test cases (CVE-*)
* Reserved header variations
* CHM (Compiled HTML Help) files with various ENCINT encodings
* CHM files with security issues

== Source

Original test files from: https://github.com/kyz/libmspack

Copied from:

* CAB files: `/Users/mulgogi/src/external/libmspack/libmspack/test/test_files/cabd/`
* CHM files: `/Users/mulgogi/src/external/libmspack/libmspack/test/test_files/chmd/`
